rules.natural: Provided that drug X is approved, drug X is not marketed.
In cases where drug X has orphan drug designation, drug X has a rare disease indication.
Given that drug X has a rare disease indication, then whenever the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it implies that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.
If FDA review of drug X is conducted, then provided the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it follows that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.
Either FDA review of drug X is conducted or drug X has fast track designation.
Provided that drug X has fast track designation, drug X has orphan drug designation.
In cases where drug X has fast track designation, drug X has priority review.
Should drug X have priority review, then if the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it follows that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.
Whenever drug X has accelerated approval, then provided the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it implies that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.
If drug X has breakthrough therapy designation, then drug X has accelerated approval.
Provided that drug X has standard review, drug X has a complete response.
If it is not the case that fast track designation of drug X implies breakthrough therapy designation, then drug X has standard review.
In the event that drug X is not manufacturing compliant, drug X is approved.

facts.natural: The clinical trial for drug X is complete.
Drug X does not have a complete response.

(A1 → A2).natural: If drug X is approved, then drug X is marketed.

(A1 → ¬A2).natural: Provided that drug X is approved, drug X is not marketed.

(A11 → (A3 → (A1 → A2))).natural: Whenever drug X has orphan drug designation, then if the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it follows that if drug X is approved, then drug X is marketed.

(A11 → A12).natural: In cases where drug X has orphan drug designation, drug X has a rare disease indication.

(A12 → (A3 → (A1 → A2))).natural: Given that drug X has a rare disease indication, then whenever the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it implies that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.

(A3 → (A1 → A2)).natural: Should the clinical trial for drug X be complete, then if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.

(A4 → (A3 → (A1 → A2))).natural: If FDA review of drug X is conducted, then provided the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it follows that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.

(A4 ∨ A5).natural: Either FDA review of drug X is conducted or drug X has fast track designation.

(A5 → (A3 → (A1 → A2))).natural: Whenever drug X has fast track designation, then if the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it implies that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.

(A5 → A11).natural: Provided that drug X has fast track designation, drug X has orphan drug designation.

(A5 → A6).natural: In cases where drug X has fast track designation, drug X has priority review.

(A5 → A7).natural: If drug X has fast track designation, then drug X has accelerated approval.

(A5 → A8).natural: Given that drug X has fast track designation, drug X has breakthrough therapy designation.

(A6 → (A3 → (A1 → A2))).natural: Should drug X have priority review, then if the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it follows that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.

(A7 → (A3 → (A1 → A2))).natural: Whenever drug X has accelerated approval, then provided the clinical trial for drug X is complete, it implies that if drug X is approved, drug X is marketed.

(A8 → A7).natural: If drug X has breakthrough therapy designation, then drug X has accelerated approval.

(A9 → A10).natural: Provided that drug X has standard review, drug X has a complete response.

(¬(A5 → A8) → A9).natural: If it is not the case that fast track designation of drug X implies breakthrough therapy designation, then drug X has standard review.

(¬G → A1).natural: In the event that drug X is not manufacturing compliant, drug X is approved.
